alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 29 at 12:24PM PDT until August 30 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY NORTHERLY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY CREATING ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS ACROSS EASTERN NAPA COUNTY... The National Weather Service in San Francisco has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 PM this evening to 8 PM PDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 504 North Bay Interior Mountains. * TIMING...11 PM this evening through 8 PM PDT Wednesday. * WINDS...North 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Tuesday night: poor overnight humidity recoveries of 30 to 40 percent. Wednesday afternoon: minimum humidity of 13 to 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Tuesday night: overnight lows of 65 to 73. Wednesday afternoon: highs of 90 to 96. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity. Outdoor burning is not recommended. *ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The area of highest concern is for eastern Napa County bordering the Sacramento Valley, including the Vaca Mountains. North winds increase after midnight tonight when humidity recoveries will be poor to moderate (30-40% RH). Winds begin to diminish late Wednesday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
